Dataset & DataLoaders¶

Kmer-count based matrix¶

This class allows us to iterate over fastas file, count kmers using the class KmerExtractionandCount and create a scipy sparse csr matrix or a pandas dataframe using these kmers counts

data.Kmercount_to_matrix.clean_temp_directories(self, kmer)¶

delete the intermediate file that were created during the command line call of the kmer-parser

Parameters

kmer -- kmer object from which the path are extracted

Returns

self

data.Kmercount_to_matrix.create_sparse_coos(self)¶

Iterate over the keys of the kmerdict containing the kmer_counts of all the strains in order to gather coordinates and datas informations for creating the sparse_csr matrix

Returns

coordinates and values of kmercount for the sparse matrix

Return type

rows, cols, datas

data.Kmercount_to_matrix.extend_kmerdicts(self, kmer)¶

Merge all individual kmer_count dictionaries created with kmers_parser into a dictionary of the form {kmer1:{strain_a:count, strain_b:count}, kmer2:{strain_a:count, strain_c:count...},...} :param kmer: object of the class kmers_parser containing a dict {kmer1:count, kmer2:count,...}

Returns

self

data.Kmercount_to_matrix.populate_sparse_matrix(self, rows, cols, data)¶

Create a sparse_csr matrix with the coordinates contained in rows cols, data

Parameters

  • rows -- list of row coordinates

  • cols -- list of cols coordinates

  • data -- kmer count values for the coordinates

Returns

self

data.Kmercount_to_matrix.run(self)¶

Run method to wrap the class methods and create the kmer count sparse matrix

Parse kmers from a fasta file using command-line softwares (DSK or Gerbil) DSK: https://github.com/GATB/dsk Gerbil: https://github.com/uni-halle/gerbil class called in KmersCount2Dataframe class

data.Kmer_parser.count_kmers_dsk(self)¶

Parse the kmer-count file generated by DSK in a dictionnary of the form {kmer: count} for the considered strain

data.Kmer_parser.count_kmers_gerbil(self)¶

Parse the kmer-count file generated by gerbil in a dictionnary of the form {kmer: count} for the considered strain

data.Kmer_parser.parse_kmers_dsk(self)¶

Use the DSK software to create a kmer-count file from the fasta file containing contigs

data.Kmer_parser.parse_kmers_gerbil(self)¶

Use the gerbil software to create a kmer-count file from the fasta file containing contigs

Genes-id based matrix¶

Use the class plfam_parser to parse plfams and create a pandas dataframe of plfams for AMR prediction

data.plfam_to_matrix.fill_dic(self, dicdata, ls_plfams)¶

Use dicdata and ls_plfams to create a dictionary (dic_df) from which a Pandas dataframe can be created

Parameters

  • dicdata -- dic {strainID: [plfams contained in the strain genome]

  • ls_plfams -- list of unique plfams

Returns

dictionary from which a Pandas dataframe can be created

Return type

dic_df

data.plfam_to_matrix.get_list_plfams(self, dic_data)¶

get the list of unique plfams for initiating the pandas dataframe

Parameters

dic_data -- {strain1:[plfam1, plfam2, ...]}

Returns

list of unique plfams

data.plfam_to_matrix.run(self)¶

Run method to wrap the class methods and create the plfams Pandas dataframe

Parse the plfam list (list of genes identifiers) for a given strain using the PATRIC.features.tab sheet.

data.plfam_parser.run(self)¶

Iterate through the lines of the PATRIC.features.tab file

Returns

prediction target

Return type

list of plfams in the file (some may appear twice since genes are sometimes redundant), y

Kmer/Genes correspondance¶

This class allows us to pairwise iterate over fastas and PATRIC.features.tab files, parse the genes sequences contained in the DNA sequence and associate the kmers with the genes they appear in in a dictionary.

data.kmer_gene_correspondance.build_kmer_gene_dict(self, dic_kmer_gene, dic_gene)¶

For each geneseq in dic_genes, parse kmers and fill dic_kmer_gene

Parameters

  • dic_kmer_gene -- {kmer:[pgfam1, pgfam2, ..]}

  • dic_gene -- {pgfam:[seq1, seq2, ..]}

Returns

{kmer:[pgfam1, pgfam2, ..]}

Return type

filled dic_kmer_gene

data.kmer_gene_correspondance.extract_genes_from_seq(self, contigs, dic_limits)¶

Use the genes limits in dic_limits to extract genes sequences from the fasta

Parameters

  • contigs -- list of assembled DNA sequence (contigs)

  • dic_limits -- {'plfam':[(limit1, limit2), numcontig],..}

Returns

{'plfam':[geneseq1, geneseq2],..}

Return type

dic_genes

data.kmer_gene_correspondance.extract_sequence(self, pathtofile)¶

return a list of contigs DNA sequences from the fasta file

Parameters

pathtofile -- path to the fasta file

Returns

list of assembled DNA sequence (contigs)

Return type

contigs

data.kmer_gene_correspondance.get_genes_from_kmers(self)¶

Method used to understand results

data.kmer_gene_correspondance.get_genes_limit(self, pathtofile)¶

Create a dictionary of the form {'plfam':[(limit1, limit2), numcontig],..}

Parameters

pathtofile -- path to the .PATRIC.features.tab

Returns

{'plfam':[(limit1, limit2), numcontig],..}

Return type

dic_limits

data.kmer_gene_correspondance.kmers_within_gene(self, geneseq, len_kmers=31)¶

extract kmers from geneseq

Parameters

  • geneseq -- DNA sequence

  • len_kmers -- len of the kmer extracted

Returns

liste of kmers contained in geneseq

Return type

ls_kmers

data.kmer_gene_correspondance.run(self)¶

Run method to wrap the class methods and create the dic_kmer_gene dic_kmer_gene: {kmer:[pgfam1, pgfam2, ..]}

Returns

self
